work.name: Johns Hopkins University
work.summary: Conducting research on understanding the multiphysics behaviors of soft hydrogel materials for soft sensing/ robotics, energy and water harvesting applications.

work.name: Washington State University
work.summary: Developed continuum dislocation plasticity model for additively manufactured metals and taught classes on numerical method-based engineering analysis.

work.name: Washington State University
work.summary: Performed research on failure mechanisms of Cu interconnects and growth of intermetallics in Cu-Sn micro solder joints in 3D electronic packagings.

publications.name: A Reactive Electrochemomechanical Theory for Growth and Remodeling of Polyelectrolyte Hydrogels and Application to Dynamic Polymerization of DNA Hydrogels
publications.publisher: Journal of the Mechanics and Physics of Solids

publications.name: Untethered Unidirectionally Crawling Gels Driven by Asymmetry in Contact Forces

projects.name: Modeling Stimuli-responsive Behaviors of Hydrogels
projects.summary: Developing multiphysics framework, constitutive models, and numerical implementation to study stimuli-responsive behaviors of hydrogels for soft robotics and water harvesting applications
